intro: Styphelia lasiostachys, commonly known as the silky lichen or dwarf heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of western Australia. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, leathery leaves that are typically covered in a fine, silvery-white pubescence. The plant produces clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late winter to early spring. Styphelia lasiostachys thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes. It is an important component of the local flora, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
